pros: Great place to work. It was a good work atmosphere. All coworkers were very helpful and had the mindset of “teamwork makes the dream work.” Physicians were also kind and easy to work with.
cons: Pay is on the lower end but if you work nightshift the shift dif is about $6-7

pros: They give you a birthday gift and marketing yeti cups.
cons: Pay is extremely low. Always short staffed but we are not allowed to tell the patients that we are. The leaders round on the floors to check on patients and askthem about their care but dont fix the issues. Old equipment.

pros: The radiology staff is friendly, helpful, and hard-working. The managers are good and do try to work with you when possible.
cons: Corporate puts absolutely no money into general maintenance or replacement of old and faulty equipment. This means that there is constantly something broken down.

pros: Working with great nurses althrough the hospital.
Nothing special about this place really

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Crestview, FL
pros: You get a lot of overtime.
cons: There isn’t enough help for the amount of patients.

job_title: Staff ICU RN in Crestview, FL
pros: I enjoyed the people I worked with
cons: Management does not care about its team members

job_title: Registered Nurse, Float Pool in Crestview, FL
pros: Started as a travel nurse and stayed
cons: Outdated charting system, and other outdated systems

pros: good pay for directors but front line employees get less than the average.
cons: Top leadership back bite, play petty games, fabricate situations to throw shade on those they don't like, sabotage other employees when they feel threatened and bully front line employees into making statements that are then twisted to imply guilt on others.

review_title: Best available within the salary range
pros: Although the management only encourages certain people to advance their position in the company, the floor staff is excellent to work with.
cons: Most staff nurses are not given the opportunity for growth within the company.  Floor nurses are needed so badly there is little chance of leaving that position without leaving the company for a leadership position at another hospital and then returning for those positions at NOMC.

pros: Great people to work with, great hourly wages, company as a whole seem to really want to keep employees satisfied
cons: Immediate supervisors don't make employees feel appreciated nor do they have good communication with employees, hours are getting cut

review_title: Great people to work with, good environment.
pros: Great people to work with. Fast paced and busy floors make shifts fly by.
cons: Very little recognition by leadership. Frequent short staffing. Lack of communication from upper levels, frequent additional tasks added.

pros: The people are great. Supportive of each other and we all help each other out, especially at the end of the day so we can get out at a decent hour.
cons: Staffing ratio is 6:1 on med/surg. Sometimes it's hard to manage as I feel I don't get to actually spend time helping my patients.

review_title: Small hospital with connection to local community
pros: Easy to communicate with physicians and nurses as needed. Monthly and quarterly service award recognitions.
cons: Cafeteria food available to employees needs to improve... not much thought put into the menu, as they have a 2-week cycle. Bring your lunch or go off campus and save yourself the disappointment.

review_title: I enjoy working there but not enough to keep me busy all day
pros: everyone I work with is real nice
Allows for skill development and time management.
cons: Poor Management and overworked.  Executive team doesn't seem to care about employees.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Crestview, FL
pros: friendly staff, physicians friendly, and respectful.
cons: Little room for promotion, and increased pay increase yearly, benefits very high.
